statements: UPDATE DataConsistency SET data='New Data 1' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE DataConsistency SET updated_at='2022-01-01 12:00:00' WHERE id=2;
UPDATE DataConsistency SET data = 'New Data', updated_at = '2022-01-01 12:00:00' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE DataConsistency SET created_at = '2022-01-01 12:00:00', updated_at = '2022-01-02 12:00:00', data = 'Updated Data' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE users SET email='newemail@example.com' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE posts SET post_content='Updated post content' WHERE post_id=10;
UPDATE users SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE posts SET post_content = 'Updated post content', created_at = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP WHERE user_id = 2
UPDATE users SET username='john_doe' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE products SET price=15.99, stock_quantity=50 WHERE product_id=5;
UPDATE users SET username = 'new_username' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE products SET stock_quantity = stock_quantity - 1, price = price * 1.1 WHERE product_id = 5;
UPDATE distributed_systems SET status = TRUE WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE nodes SET location = 'New York', capacity = 100 WHERE node_id = 3;
UPDATE distributed_systems SET description = 'Updated description', status = FALSE WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE nodes SET capacity = 100, location = 'New Location' WHERE node_id = 5;
UPDATE Users SET email='newemail@example.com' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE Products SET is_available=FALSE WHERE product_id=10;
UPDATE Users SET email='newemail@example.com', username='newusername' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE Products SET price=29.99, is_available=FALSE WHERE product_id=5;
